frontmatter.title: Migrating to GatsbyJS
frontmatter.author: creativcoder
frontmatter.excerpt: A blog post on the experience

markdownRemark.html:
Hey everyone! It's been a long time since I wrote here. For the past few weeks, I have been working to revamp this blog. I am not so into frontend development, but to stay updated in the domain and my blog acts as a frontend learning playgrond, where every now and then I try learning new frontend technologies. I think this is a decent update to the blog where I got to learn many new web technologies i.e., gatsby, graphql, typescipt, styled components and what not. So the migration was worth the learning.

After a lot of sifting throught the internet, I decided to migrate my blog to GatsbyJS. This is a blog post on the experience!

What is GatsbyJS?

GatsbyJS is yet another framework for building static sites. But it's different and it can do more. It can also build dyamic sites as well. It follows a very refreshing architecture compared to existing static site generators. Read on to know more:

What I like about GatsbyJS?

  • Uses Graphql as a middleware layer for querying data for frontend templates. This makes it very convenient to query data and create a model
  • It uses components to model various sections and layouts for a given site. These components can be composed and reused just like in other react frameworks.

Have a great day!
